meanings.sent1: The osteal structure of the skull provides protection for the brain.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the osteal composition of the patient's fractured arm.
meanings.sent3: The osteal strength of the dinosaur bones amazed the paleontologists.
meanings.sent4: Her osteal grip on the rock wall helped her climb to the top effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The osteal quality of the ancient fossils made them valuable for research.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the bones of the body
meanings.sent1: The osteal structure of the ribcage supports and protects vital organs.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully examined the osteal structure of the patient's spine.
meanings.sent3: The osteal nature of the skeleton costume made it a hit at the Halloween party.
meanings.sent4: His osteal determination to succeed in sports led him to victory.
meanings.sent5: The osteal framework of the building ensured its stability during earthquakes.
